Docs.summary: Provides low-level access to the HealthVault item operations.
Docs.remarks: uses this class to perform operations. Set HealthVaultPlatformItem.Current to a derived class to intercept all calls.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string GetTransformedItems (Microsoft.Health.ApplicationConnection connection, Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordAccessor accessor, Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordSearcher searcher, string transform);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetTransformedItems(class Microsoft.Health.ApplicationConnection connection, class Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordAccessor accessor, class Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordSearcher searcher, string transform) cil managed
Public Overridable Function GetTransformedItems (connection As ApplicationConnection, accessor As HealthRecordAccessor, searcher As HealthRecordSearcher, transform As String) As String

abstract member GetTransformedItems : Microsoft.Health.ApplicationConnection * Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordAccessor * Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordSearcher * string -> string override this.GetTransformedItems : Microsoft.Health.ApplicationConnection * Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordAccessor * Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordSearcher * string -> string

Docs.param: The connection to use to access the data.
The record to use.
The searcher that defines what items to return.
A URL to a transform to run on the resulting XML. This can be a fully-qualified URL or the name of one of the standard XSLs provided by the HealthVault system.
Docs.summary: Gets the health record items specified by the and runs them through the specified transform.
Docs.returns: The string resulting from performing the specified transform on the XML representation of the items.
Docs.remarks:
This method accesses the HealthVault service across the network.
Any call to HealthVault may specify a transform to be run on the response XML. The transform can be specified as a XSL fragment or a well-known transform tag provided by the HealthVault service. If a XSL fragment is specified, it gets compiled and cached on the server.
A final-xsl is useful when you want to convert the result from XML to HTML so that you can display the result directly in a web page. You may also use it to generate other data formats like CCR, CCD, CSV, RSS, etc.
Transform fragments cannot contain embedded script. The following set of parameters are passed to all final-xsl transforms:
currentDateTimeUtc - the date and time just before the transform started executing
requestingApplicationName - the name of the application that made the request to HealthVault.
countryCode - the ISO 3166 country code from the request.
languageCode - the ISO 639-1 language code from the request.
personName - the name of the person making the request.
recordName - if the request identified a HealthVault record to be used, this parameter contains the name of that record.
Docs.exception: does not contain the XML section in the view.
There is a failure retrieving the items. -or- No filters have been specified.

Docs.param: The connection to use to access the data.
The record to use.
The health record items from which to create new instances.
Docs.summary: Creates new health record items associated with the record.
Docs.remarks: This method accesses the HealthVault service across the network.
Docs.exception: The HealthVault service returned an error. The exception's Error property will contain the index of the item on which the failure occurred in the ErrorInfo property. If any failures occur, no items will have been created.
At least one HealthRecordItem in the supplied list was null.

Docs.param: The connection to use to access the data.
The record to use.
The unique item identifiers of the items to remove.
Docs.summary: Marks the specified health record item as deleted.
Docs.remarks:
This method accesses the HealthVault service across the network.
Health record items are never completely deleted. They are marked as deleted and are ignored for most normal operations. Items can be undeleted by contacting customer service.
Docs.exception: Errors removed the health record items from the server. The exception's Error property will contain the index of the item on which the failure occurred in the ErrorInfo property. If any failures occur, no items will have been removed.

Docs.param: The connection to use to access the data.
The record to use.
The health record items to be updated.
Docs.summary: Updates the specified health record items in one batch call to the service.
Docs.remarks:
Only new items are updated with the appropriate unique identifier. All other sections must be updated manually.
This method accesses the HealthVault service across the network.
Docs.exception: The contains a null member or a instance that does not have an ID.

The HealthVault service returned an error. The exception's Error property will contain the index of the item on which the failure occurred in the ErrorInfo property. If any failures occur, no items will have been updated.
